doc.after: In general relativity the effects of gravitation are ascribed to spacetime curvature instead of a force The starting point for general relativity is the equivalence principle which equates free fall with inertial motion and describes free falling inertial objects as being accelerated relative to non inertial observers on the ground 7 8 In Newtonian physics however no such acceleration can occur unless at least one of the objects is being operated on by a force
